text:
Hello Team!
I am trying to debug an error in production but when I try to see the API logs I find empty response. Can anyone help me out?

According to this looks like this currently does not exist :confused:
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/How-to-Get-Current-Login-User-Details-From-API/m-p/387374>

I’m using the *Read a batch of objects by internal ID, or unique property values* API on the associations page
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/associations>
Is there any way to get the associations of the returned objects, i’m not sure why this api is on the associations page otherwise?

thanks <@U03MRDD9668>
this post is 2 years old, hoping to get a response from HubSpot team though :wink:

Yeah I see, sorry was all I know & could find on the topic :slightly_smiling_face: If you want a response from HubSpot I think you need to use the community forum or open an idea, I don’t think they monitor this slack.
ok thanks <@U03MRDD9668> :thumbsup:
Hi guys, I created a contact through CRM APIs. How can I send this contact an automated welcome email? Can anybody shed light to this issue.
Enroll the new Contact in a Workflow that sends the emai.
Ok thank you for the hint. I will try to create a work flow that sends email Can I start workflow from API call as I have to send contact details from my system?
<https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/workflows/add_contact>
Great, I will check this. Thank you Justin
Hey everyone, it it possible to get meeting attendees from the engagement API?
solution found :slightly_smiling_face:
thanks for the help
hi everyone! is it possible to revert to old API key format for my account? I’m using an old plugin and it can’t read your new private apps key?
I doubt you can do this.. what is the plugin? Have you reached out to see if they are updating it?
meetings in the crm are for “face to face” meetings — it isn’t pulling in from a “meeting”
I don’t believe
they are no updating it, this is why i’m here
it’s a HubSpot integration plugin for postaffiliatepro platform
and this is a wordpress plugin? you should be able to chagne the way it authenitcates by creating a new private app and switching out the authentication
no it isn’t a wordpress
it’s a post affiliate pro plugin
i’ve gave it the key made by a private app, but it didn’t work
you woul dhave to modify the code of the plugin
to authenticate using a private app vs the api key
well sir, that’s the problem, i’m not a dev to be able to do it)

okay, how can I help! Are you trying to understand how to do this yourself or are you asking for someone to do this for you?

Apologies
none of it, I was asking if there’s a way to revert to old API keys version somehow
but if it’s impossible, then ¯\_(ツ)_/¯
thank you for your time Nicholas!  I appreciate
no, they sunset api keys <https://developers.HubSpot.com/changelog/upcoming-api-key-sunset>
so the only way to do this would be to modify the code. If this is somethign that is important, it should only take a developer a few hours to get this working for you

Is there any way to send out an email via API to a contact and attach a file from the HubSpot file manager to that email? I’ve looked into <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/email> but this seems to be just an activity log of an email, and doesn’t actually send the email (?)

do you need to send it out via the api, and does it need to be attached?

1. because you have a link to the file in the HubSpot file manager, you can just create a button in the email that says “download” and give it a url of the file manager file

To send emails via the api, you need the transactional email add on, and then you could do it that way

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/marketing/transactional-emails>

The files are private so ideally it would be attached as an attachment in the email (the file is a signed contract that would be sent out to the contact who signed the contract as a copy for their own records).

There is no way to make an attachment in a HubSpot api email send (or even in marketing emails, to my knowledge)

attaching vs having a button where they download it is the same, in the long run.

If you have an issue with the file not being private, then storing it in the file manager IS the issue here before sending attachments — as either way the file isn’t private…

So if you could attach this file as an attachment, you would just be masking that the file isn’t private.

I noticed private files are not able to be added as an attachment on a contact/company unless they are added as an attachment via API, that’s why I was hoping I would be able to attach the file to an email send as well.
oh, well I might be mistken, can you show me soemthing regarding private files? I might not know about that

When you are on a company record and try to attach a private file, it is grayed out/disabled so it’s not able to be added… but I found out if you attach the file to a note via API then it is able to be tacked on as an attachment to the company or contact record.
I was hoping sending an email would be the same but I don’t think what I’m trying to accomplish is possible :disappointed:
gotcha, yeah, sending an email with an attachment isn’t somethign HubSpot can do to my knowledge
:pray:
yeah, you would to use like mailgun I think, or something similar

Hi.. I’m trying to get all the data for a specific contact via GET method but failed..
Tried below URL’s in the POSTMAN but failed
```<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/contacts?properties=firstname&value=Hassan>```
```<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/contacts/properties?property=firstname&value=Hassan>```
Please assist on this.. Urgent
Note: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/contacts>
